meanings.definition: A barrier with a gate for controlling access.
meanings.sent1: The gatings at the entrance of the park ensure only authorized people can enter.
meanings.sent2: The old farmhouse had beautiful gatings leading up to the front door.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel managed to climb over the gatings and sneak into the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her strict rules acted as gatings, allowing only a few friends to visit her house.
meanings.sent5: The gatings of the castle were so grand that they left visitors in awe.

meanings.definition: The act of providing or installing gates.
meanings.sent1: His job involved the gatings of new fences around the property.
meanings.sent2: The company specialized in the gatings of security systems for homes.
meanings.sent3: The gatings of the playground were done in record time by the construction team.
meanings.sent4: She took pride in the gatings of the garden, making sure they were both functional and stylish.
meanings.sent5: The gatings of the city were a massive project that required skilled workers.

meanings.definition: The process of selecting or allowing certain data or information to pass through a gate.
meanings.sent1: The gatings of the firewall prevented unauthorized access to sensitive information.
meanings.sent2: The gatings of the website ensured only registered users could view the content.
meanings.sent3: The gatings of the email system sometimes caused delays in receiving important messages.
meanings.sent4: Her thorough gatings of the research data helped filter out irrelevant information.
meanings.sent5: The gatings of the security system were so precise that not even a single byte could pass without permission.
